member.summary: Defines a method that returns a description of the current run.

remarks.name: PerfRunDescriptorAttribute
remarks.para: The tags a method that returns the feature tested value in function of the run index.
For instance, if you are testing collections with increasing number of elements, the feature tested value is the number of elements processed.

member.name: T:NPerf.Framework.PerfSetUpAttribute

remarks.name: PerfSetUpAttribute
remarks.para: The SetUp attribute marks a specific method inside a class that has already been marked with the , as a test setup method.
The method takes the test index and the tested type as parameter. The method must return void.
Because of .Net JIT, a first run must be made on the test in order to avoid the overhead of the compilation. In this case, the testIndex is set to -1.

member.name: T:NPerf.Framework.PerfTearDownAttribute

remarks.name: PerfTearDownAttribute
remarks.para: The PerfTearDown attribute marks a specific method inside a class, that has already been marked with the , as a test teardown method.
The method must take the tested type as parameter.

member.name: T:NPerf.Framework.PerfTestAttribute
T:NPerf.Framework.PerfTesterAttribute

remarks.name: PerfTesterAttribute
remarks.para: This is the attribute that marks a class that contains performance test methods. This attribute is contained in the NPerf.Framework namespace.
The user must specify the type to which the performance tests are to be applied. This type is supplied in the constructor.

member.example:
In this example, we mark a class to benchmark sorter algorithms defined by the ISorter interface, and that should run 3 times: using NPerf.Framework;
[PerfTester(typeof(IDictionary),10)] public class SorterTester { ... } A test description, and a featured value description can be specified in the attribute constructor: [PerfTester(typeof(IDictionary),10, Description="...", FeatureDescription="...")] public class SorterTester ...
